results.title: From Camelot to Christ [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: J Williams, Caryl Ebenezer, Comataldh Craolaidh Gaidhlig, S4C International, Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales) and Opus Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Celts”.
The fourth in a six part series that discusses the history and legends of the Celtic people of Early Europe through to the year 2000. This program focuses on the Dark Ages, a time of the collapse of the Roman Empire in Britain and the impact this had on the future of the Celtic kingdoms is discussed. The removal of Roman authority in the north left the way open for fierce battles over dominant power in the Celtic kingdom. At this time the battle between the Saxons and the British began, with the ultimate success of the Saxons over the Celtic world despite the efforts of the Celtic heroes, rendered in Celtic folklore for the respite they brought for the British before the ultimate failure of their attempts to hold onto independence. One of the great figures to emerge from this time was Arthur, said to have halted the Saxon advance until the onset of the bubonic plague and the resulting disastrous effects on the British population which allowed the Saxons to conquer once again. At the same time the emergence of Christianity in Ireland is investigated in the program, with a discussion of the establishment of a veneer of the Roman Church over the already existing religious beliefs in the Celtic world and the eventual ruin of the true Celtic Church this caused.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J Williams, Caryl Ebenezer, Comataldh Craolaidh Gaidhlig, S4C International, Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales) and Opus Television

results.title: From box kite to swing wing
results.brief_description: In 1914 the Australian Army started a flying school at Point Cook. The trainees took ten hours to learn to fly a Box Kite Plane. This video documents the history of air defence force planes from this humble beginning to their inclusion in World War I through to the sophisticated jet fighters that are the pride of the Royal Australian Air Force today.

results.title: From birth to walking
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Developing child”.
During the first months of his life the child gradually discovers the world of sensory experience that surrounds him. “From birth to walking” aims to encourage parents to become more involved with their young children by providing an interesting and stimulating environment and a loving relationship. This film is the second in a four part series.

results.title: From Arnhemland to the Kimberley Ranges
results.creator_credit: Ashley Smith, David Tunnell, David Leonard, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
On this video, containing the first four episodes of the series, Major Hiddins takes us into the heart of Arnhem Land where the Aborigines of Ngukurr reveal their bush tucker secrets. From there he moves to the northwest of the Northern Territory during the wet season, through some of the most arid desert country in Australia to the heart of the spectacular Kimberley region.

results.title: From alchemy to the atom
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode six from “Out of the Fiery Furnace.” Scientists of the 20th century discover how to to transform matter not into gold but into energy. European scientists work towards an understanding of atoms and the energy they release.

results.title: From a small island to a giant continent : the story of a Cypriot Turk
results.creator_credit: Ifran Hassan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ifran Hassan recalls leaving his homeland of Cyprus in 1970 to escape the troubled political climate, his destination, Melbourne where he set out to make a new life for himself and to help improve the lives of others.

results.title: From 5 to 7.30
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Read and American Temperance Society
results.brief_description: Shows the effect that drinking parents can have on their children. Joe is deeply disturbed when one of his schoolmates, because of his drinking, is involved in a motor car accident. His conviction is strengthened because he see the results of social drinking and “the cocktail hour” in his own home, and in that of his girl-friend. He seeks advice from his coach at school, and attends a lecture by Dr Andrew C. Ivy, which results in his decision to “leave it alone”.

results.title: Frogs and how they live
results.brief_description: Uses close-up photography toreveal key concepts about this familiar amphibian. The process of metamorphosis, hibernation and details of major body parts are also shown. Suitable for secondary level.
